timeline.message: feat: Initial implementation for OAuth with Azure.
feat: Implement the changes to redirect to Azure.
chore: Add debug statements and a TODO.
refactor: Generate a unique key for the state.
refactor: Update versioning and remove redirect code.
feat: Add components to create a customer oauth button.
feat: have the UI redirect to the Azure login.
refactor: add todos and redirect to the azure channel UI config.
refactor: Update the endpoint fields to display field errors.
refactor: Add a checkmark if OAuth is authenticated.

timeline.body: I think it might be best if we make this extend `CustomEndpoint` so that we aren't bound to return a `String` later. We should start moving away from `ResponseEntity<String>` IMO. If we do that, we can just return a `OAuthEndpointResponse` rather than wrapping and manually serializing with `Gson`.
timeline.bodyText: I think it might be best if we make this extend CustomEndpoint so that we aren't bound to return a String later. We should start moving away from ResponseEntity<String> IMO. If we do that, we can just return a OAuthEndpointResponse rather than wrapping and manually serializing with Gson.
timeline.bodyHTML: I think it might be best if we make this extend CustomEndpoint so that we aren't bound to return a String later. We should start moving away from ResponseEntity<String> IMO. If we do that, we can just return a OAuthEndpointResponse rather than wrapping and manually serializing with Gson.
timeline.author: gkillough

timeline.body:
Could we do something like this?
```suggestion
                configurationAccessor.getConfigurationById(Long.valueOf(fieldModel.getId()))
                .map(ConfigurationModel::getCopyOfKeyToFieldMap)
                .ifPresent(fields::putAll);
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
Could we do something like this?

Suggested change
Optional<ConfigurationModel> configurationFieldModel = configurationAccessor.getConfigurationById(Long.valueOf(fieldModel.getId()));
configurationFieldModel.ifPresent(model -> fields.putAll(model.getCopyOfKeyToFieldMap()));
configurationAccessor.getConfigurationById(Long.valueOf(fieldModel.getId()))
.map(ConfigurationModel::getCopyOfKeyToFieldMap)
.ifPresent(fields::putAll);
timeline.author: gkillough

timeline.body: Is the 300 here the max length? We should probably throw an exception if we violate that constraint if it's required by Microsoft.
timeline.bodyText: Is the 300 here the max length? We should probably throw an exception if we violate that constraint if it's required by Microsoft.
timeline.bodyHTML: Is the 300 here the max length? We should probably throw an exception if we violate that constraint if it's required by Microsoft.
timeline.author: gkillough

replies.bodyText: The 300 isn't a max length.  It's a best guess for initial capacity.  My test URL was 237 characters long. This is so the StringBuilder allocates a string with enough capacity initially instead of resizing more than once with the append calls.  it will resize dynamically like an ArrayList.  So this just makes it perform a little better. The string underneath is backed by a character array. So the character array will be created with a good enough size to avoid resizing during the append calls.
replies.author: psantos1113

timeline.body: Same thought here. If this is the length requirement, we should be more explicit about it.
timeline.bodyText: Same thought here. If this is the length requirement, we should be more explicit about it.
timeline.bodyHTML: Same thought here. If this is the length requirement, we should be more explicit about it.
timeline.author: gkillough

replies.bodyText: The 250 isn't a max length.  It's a best guess for initial capacity.  My test URL was 237 characters long. This is so the StringBuilder allocates a string with enough capacity initially instead of resizing more than once with the append calls.  it will resize dynamically like an ArrayList.  So this just makes it perform a little better.  The string underneath is backed by a character array.  So the character array will be created with a good enough size to avoid resizing during the append calls.
replies.author: psantos1113
